item.title: Data manipulation with dplyr
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Data Science
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: My Story with R
item.description: I will start by speeking how did i know R for the first time. I remember it was in the second year of my engineering degree in computer science. Me and my classmates knew R in the course of knowledge engineering. In 2007/2008, i was in my second year in my M.Sc. degree, and my supervisor was our instructor of the knowledge engineering course who was a very competent teacher and supervisor and who loves her job.
